subject: Boston Marathon
lead_paragraph: Lidiya Grigoryeva of Russia, who won the Boston Marathon women’s race last year, and Rita Jeptoo of Kenya, who won the year before, will compete April 21 in the 112th running of the event. Marathon officials also announced that Jelena Prokopcuka of Latvia, the runner-up the last two years, would be back. The women’s field will include three young Ethiopians: Askale Tafa Magarsa, 23, who won in Paris and Dubai last year; Dire Tune, 22, the Houston winner last year and this year; and Robe Tola Guta, 21, who won in Hamburg, Germany, two years ago. Other entries include Tetyana Kuzina-Hladyr of Ukraine, Magdaline Chemjor of Kenya, Alevtina Biktimirova of Russia and Bruna Genovese of Italy.The best American women will race on a different course the day before in the United States Olympic trials.
